title: Valley Forge National Historical Park: Ranger Programs
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Ranger Programs               Ranger Programs       Ranger-led Walking Tours March to Valley Forge This 1/4-mile guided walk explores the Valley Forge winter encampment and its impact on the American Revolution. A living history program will take place at the huts following the walk.  Tour Schedule    March 19 through June 5, 2016 weekends at 10:50,12:50, and 2:50   June 11 through September 5, 2016 daily at 10:50, 12:50 and 2:50         Living History Muhlenberg Brigade Huts Meet a Continental soldier! Experience a day in the life at the Valley Forge encampment.  Program Schedule    January 2, 2016 through June 5, 2016 weekends from 10:00 to 4:00   Ranger Talks at 11:30, 1:30 and 3:30 Saturdays - Historic Weapons Demonstrations Sundays - A Solider's Life   June 11 through September 5, 2016 daily from 10:00 to 4:00   Ranger Talks at 11:30, 1:30 and 3:30 Sunday-Tuesday - A Soldiers Life Wednesday-Saturday - Historic Weapons Demonstrations  Special Program Days  Bake Oven Demonstrations June 18, July 16 and 30, August 13, September 3, 2016  Artillery Demonstrations May 7 at Artillery Park June 18, July 4, August 27, October 8, 2016      Ranger Talks Who Were Those Ragtag Rebels? At the Steuben Statue  Could you have been a Continental Soldier? Learn about the men and women who made up the army here at Valley Forge. Program Schedule  June 11 through September 5, 2016 weekends at 11:00 and 3:00  Memories in Stone At the National Memorial Arch Valley Forge looks very different today then it did during the encampment. Discover the meanings behind the monuments and memorials of Valley Forge.  Program Schedule  June 11 through September 5, 2016 weekends at 12:00 and 2:00
